page.title: 17A non-school day
page.content: I cycle about two miles to the shops. Comics cost about twenty pence, a computer magazine a pound, a bag of potato crisps twelve pence and a small carton of fruit juice twenty five pence. On the way back I might window shop for ten minutes or so, then cycle home to read the comic and magazine and consume the crisps and fruit juice. On Saturday evenings I sometimes play squash with my Dad or brother. Dinner usually consists of chips with either fish, beefburgers or sausages. I collect stamps, especially commemorative sets like fish, boats insects, and British composers. I like drawing and painting. My brother's girlfriend has passsed her art degree, so I can use her paint, inks and pens. My best sports are snooker, tennis, squash, and swimming. I go to Amersham Swimming Club twice a week.
